name: Footnotes to Fame Quiz | Mixed People | 10 Questions

questions.text: Abraham Lincoln was not the principal speaker at Gettysburg when he delivered his famous address. Who was?
questions.explanation:
Edward Everett.

	Webster was a great orator in his {day;} Clay was a prominent poitician. Sumner is known primarily for being beaten with a cane by another senator. It was Everett, however, who preceded Lincoln and spoke for 2 hours.

questions.text: Which of these individuals are associated with famous aviators?
options: John Condon and Ernst Lindemann and Fred Noonan
questions.explanation:
Fred Noonan and John Condon.

	Noonan disappeared along with Amelia {Earhart;} he was her navigator. Condon was a 'colorful' figure who injected himself into the middle of the Lindbergh baby kidnapping. Lindemann was commander of the Bismarck when it sank during WW II.

questions.text: Reference is often made to carrying 'a message to Garcia'. In what war was Garcia a figure?
questions.explanation:
Spanish-American War.

	It's a famous story of courage and heroism by Elbert Hubbard. (No kidding)

questions.text: A woman named Tituba is closely associated with famous events in what state?
questions.explanation:
Massachusetts.

	Tituba was one of the first women to be charged with witchcraft in Salem.

questions.text: Andrew Johnson was impeached, but he wasn't tossed out of office. If he had been removed from the presidency, who would have succeeded him?
questions.explanation:
Benjamin Wade.

	Wade was president of the senate and next in line. Hamlin was Lincoln's first vice president. Breckinridge was the 'other' key candidate (along with Stephen Douglas) who ran against Lincoln in 1860.

questions.text: Ruth Paine is famous (in a small way) in connection with the death of what individual?
questions.explanation:
John Kennedy.

	Paine was the Dallas woman in whose home the Oswalds stayed in the days prior to the assassination.

questions.text: Benteen and Reno are associated with what famous soldier?
questions.explanation:
George Custer.

	Both played prominent roles in 'Custer's Last Stand' at the Little Big Horn.

questions.text: Francis Drake is remembered as the hero of the English battle with the Spanish Armada in 1588, but other men also played pivotal roles. Who were they?
options: Humphrey Gilbert and John Hawkins and Martin Frobisher
questions.explanation:
Martin Frobisher and John Hawkins.

	Frobisher and Hawkins were key players. Gilbert died before the {battle;} he was a major figure in the search for the 'Northwest Passage'.

questions.text: The 'Judgment of Paris' in a beauty contest involving 'Helen of Troy' sparked the Trojan War. Which of the following was NOT one of the contestants?
Waterloo is remembered as the battle that Napoleon lost. Who won?
questions.explanation:
Wellington.

	The Iron Duke - a man who never lost.
